p: Adolescents have used the UN Conventions on the Rights of the Child, including the right to life and health, in lawsuits against governments. In a legal petition filed by 16 adolescents against five G20 members (Argentina, Brazil, France, Germany, and Turkey), claiming violation of their rights, Deborah Adegbile of Nigeria asserted that she had been repeatedly admitted to hospital for asthma attacks, triggered by rising temperatures and smog.32 Upholding their right to education, students at Santa Paz National High School in the Philippines won a campaign to have their school relocated because of the risk of a landslide.33 Adolescents are also taking what they have learnt about climate change to educate their families and communities, driving broader societal action.34
